chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)
Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Juan Macias Alcaraz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (2nd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).
  • Hit and Run, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.67(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.
*  Pay supervision fees.
Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.
*  Pay fine of $500.00 and court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.
*  Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.
Spend 5 days in the county jail w/huber privileges, consecutive to Ct.2.

timeConds.notes: Consecutive to Ct.2.  Huber & work crew authorized.

supervisions.notes: BOND APPLIED - fine/costs pd in full.
Huber & work crew authorized.  Deft is not eligible for an electronic leg monitor.  Time may be served in Racine, but no electronic leg monitor privileges.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Juan Macias Alcaraz

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Court has reviewed notice of financial obligations and victim witness fees have been paid.  Civil judgment may be entered for any court ordered financial obligations remaining upon discharge.

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge
5 days KCJ consecutive to Ct.2.  kmk

Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State. Defendant, Juan  Macias Alcaraz, appeared with Attorney Matthew Tyler Luening.  Interpreter Leo Martin in court.  Clerk: PT
Interpreter Martin is sworn in.  Amended Information filed by the State and case is resolved.  Counts 1 & 2 - DE pleads Guilty; found guilty by the Court.  Sentencing arguments made.  
Count 1 -   Sentence is withheld and DE is placed on probation for 18 months with conditions.  As a condition court imposes 5 days in the KCJ.  Sentencing in Count 1 is Consecutive to Count 2.   Huber & Work Crew authorized.  Court imposes a fine of $500 plus costs and any remaining balance of bond is to be applied.  If any unpaid financial obligations that remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.   
Count 2 - Defendant is sentenced to 120 days in the KCJ commencing on 4/16/16 at 8:00 AM.  Credit  for 6 days.  Huber & Work Crew is authorized, but DE is not eligible for an Electronic Leg Monitor.  Time may be served in Racine, but no electronic leg monitor privileges. Court imposes a fine of $300 plus costs & surcharge.  Cash Bond on deposit is to be applied.  
 Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge in both Counts and notice is given.  DE's driving privileges are revoked for 18 months.  AODA Assessment & Ignition Interlock ordered.  Appeal Rights given.

records.descr: Order for intox driver assessment and safety plan

records.addlTxt: Plea hearing on April 6, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
Interpreter request sent to Jury Clerk for 4/6/16
Per confirmation with Atty Luening; Plea Hearing scheduled 4/6/16 at 2:30 PM.

NO RECORD TAKEN:   Attorney Margaret Drees appeared for the State. Attorney Matthew Tyler Luening appeared prior to court.  Clerk: PT
Case is resolved and Atty Luening requests another day for a plea due to his calendar in Milwaukee.  Trial is canceled for Monday and court will allow another date for a plea.
State's Amended List of Witnesses and Demand for Discovery - filed by ADA, Margaret Drees  kmk

Attorney Margaret Drees appeared for the State.  Def. appeared with Atty Matthew Luening and assisted by Spanish interpreter Leo Martin.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  Case is not resolved.  Jury status hearing 3/17/16 at 1:00.  Jury trial 3/21/16 at 8:30.  Bond continued.
State's List of Witnesses and Demand for Discovery - filed by ADA, Margaret Drees  kmk

Attorney Margaret Drees appeared for the State.  Def. appeared with Atty Matthew Luening.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  Atty Luening requests time to review video evidence with def.  FPT 1/14/16 at 10:30.  Bond continued.
Time of pretrial on 12/18/15 changed from 9:30 to 10:30 at request of Atty Luening.

Defendant, Juan Macias Alcaraz, appeared with Attorney Matthew Tyler Luening and spanish interpreter Rick Kissell who is sworn in.  Attorney Margaret Drees appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk JThwing. Minutes: Atty Luening is fluent in spanish and reviewed the paperwork with the DE.   DE waives preliminary hearing; probable cause found. Bound over to Br 8.  Information filed, reading waived. Not guilty pleas entered. Bond continued.  Final pre-trial scheduled for December 18, 2015 at 09:30 am.

MODIFIED

Special Prosecutor Daniel Tombasco appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Matthew Luening.  Leo Martin, spanish interpreter, appeared with the defendant.  Clerk JThwing. Minutes:  Defendant requests preliminary hearing within 20 days; set before Commissioner on October 20, 2015 at 09:15 am.  Bond modified to $1500  Cash Bond Set w/conditions (see bond entry).  kmk
Atty Luening call to say he had been retained by DE.  Atty status hearing set 10-06-15 at 1pm.
Atty called and left message with the court system,  called back and phone message states,  answering machine is full, not accepting any more messages.

229pm Special Prosecutor Daniel Tombasco appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person.  Leo Martin, spanish interpreter, appeared with the defendant.  Clerk JThwing. Minutes:  Def. is referred to the Public Defender.  If not eligible, def. to retain his own counsel. Court date will not be adjourned due to def.'s failure to retain counsel.  Deft will retain his own counsel.  Defendant requests preliminary hearing within 10 days; set before Commissioner on October 9, 2015 at 10:00 am.  $5000  Cash Bond Set w/conditions (see bond entry).  Deft has retained an attorney from Milwaukee - Tomas Loring may be his name.  Deft remanded into custody of KSD.  kmk
